p: The content of volatile compounds and the dominant chemotype varies with botanical specie, geographical origin, and the harvest time. Therefore, the study carried out by Imelouane et al. [ 36] have revealed camphor as the major compound (39.390%) of Thymus vulgaris L. essential oil cultivated in Morocco, while Hudaib et al. [ 33] have identified carvacrol, as the main chemotype of this essential oil. In another study conducted by Schmidt et al. [ 32], linalool has been found as the major compound of Thymus vulgaris L. essential oil (72.5%).
